name: miscalculation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a calculation that has not been done correctly, or the act of calculating something wrongly: The project went over budget because of a miscalculation at the planning stage. They are calling for a recount because of errors and miscalculations in the compilation of the poll result.
a wrong judgment about a situation: The conspirators' plot failed because they made two fatal miscalculations. I think they were trying to cover up for their grossly negligent political miscalculation. See
miscalculate
More examplesFewer examplesHe said it was necessary to find out exactly how the miscalculation occurred.Due to a slight miscalculation on my part, my new sofa wouldn't fit up the stairs.This conflict is the result of a grave miscalculation.

ACCOUNTING the act of calculating an amount wrongly: The claim that the group's net asset value was $22 a share was a miscalculation.miscalculation of sth About £265 million could be incurred in fines for miscalculation of tax.
the act of judging a situation badly: It is a story of bad judgement and business miscalculation which resulted in the CEO being fired. The company made a big miscalculation by closing down the retail side of the business.
